intro: Didymoglossum denticulatum, commonly known as the toothed moss, is a small, mat-forming moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its slender, wiry stems and leaf-like structures that are often slightly toothed or serrated. This species typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. It is found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, including Europe, Asia, and North America. Didymoglossum denticulatum plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
